    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        In onCreate, we gather all of the linearLayout's that are associated with each port. this is how the legacy_module.xml file is reused, but we read and write to the correct Spinners, EditTexts, TextViews, and Buttons. The TextView port# is set during onCreate as a way to "name" that chunk of xml code. Each layout is then identified by the port number.

      • onStart

        protected void onStart()

      • editController_portALL

        public void editController_portALL(View v)
        When the drop-down item is a Controller, this button appears. Clicking it launches the appropriate activity
        Parameters:
        v - - the button that got pressed

      • buildDevice

        protected com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.configuration.DeviceConfiguration buildDevice(java.lang.String type,
                                                                                        java.lang.String name,
                                                                                        com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.configuration.DeviceConfiguration module,
                                                                                        int port)
        Used while saving state. This gets all of the information from the UI elements, and creates the appropriate objects.
        Parameters:
        type - - type of device
        name - - the name of the device
        module - - the actual module itself
        port - - the port it's attached to
        Returns:
        the device we just created from the UI elements
